thread.title: Here's how you can watch Mets-Cubs NLCS Game 4

title: Here's how you can watch Mets-Cubs NLCS Game 4
text:
Here's how you can watch Mets-Cubs NLCS Game 4 Here's how you can watch Mets-Cubs NLCS Game 4 
Oct 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; A general view of the New York Mets taking batting practice prior to game three of the NLCS against the Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field. (Aaron Doster/USA Today Sports) reviewjournal.com 
The National League Championship Series between the New York Mets and the Chicago Cubs continues today with Game 4 at Wrigley Field in Chicago. 
The Mets lead the series 3-0 
Here's what you need to know to catch the game. 
Time: 5:07 p.m. PDT 
TV: TBS (DirecTV 247, Cox 7, Century Link 113, Dish 139) 
Online: MLB.com (subscription required) 
Schedule through Game 7 (all times PDT): 
Game 5: Mets at Cubs (if necessary) — Thursday, Oct. 22, 5:07 p.m. — TBS 
Game 6: Cubs at Mets (if necessary) — Saturday, Oct. 24, 1:07 p.m.— TBS 
Game 7: Cubs at Mets (if necessary) — Sunday, Oct. 25, 5:07 p.m. — TBS Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las   or GateHouse Media. This public platform is intended to provide a forum for users of reviewjournal.com to share ideas, express thoughtful opinions and carry the conversation beyond the article.
